step1.sentence: She stayed up late to pack a bag before her early morning flight.

step2.story: Tom had only thirty minutes to pack a bag before the taxi arrived. He tossed in a few shirts, his charger, and his passport, then zipped the bag shut. It wasn't perfect, but it would do.

step3.story: Emma got the call on a Friday afternoon — her grandmother had fallen ill, and she needed to fly out that same evening. She rushed home and started to pack a bag, grabbing only the essentials: a change of clothes, her toiletries, and her laptop. Her hands were shaking slightly as she moved around the room. She kept second-guessing herself, wondering if she was forgetting something important. Finally, she zipped the bag closed, took a deep breath, and headed for the door. There was no time to overthink — she just had to go.

meaning.realUsageKo: 여행이나 외출을 앞두고 필요한 물건들을 가방에 넣는 행위를 뜻하며, 주로 이동 준비를 시작할 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'pack'은 중세 영어에서 '짐을 묶다'는 의미로 사용되었으며, 'bag'과 결합해 일상적인 짐 싸기 행동을 나타내는 표현으로 자리 잡았다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 급하게 떠나야 하는 상황이나 계획된 여행 모두에 자연스럽게 쓰이며, 가방의 종류(suitcase, backpack 등)에 상관없이 두루 사용할 수 있다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Don't forget to pack a bag for the camping trip this weekend.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 이번 주말 캠핑 여행을 위해 가방 싸는 것 잊지 마세요.
